DOC.brief_title: Neural Functioning Feeding Centers Obese Youth
DOC.detailed_description: Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging ( fMRI ) provide non-invasive method assess functional pathway affect nutrient ingestion therefore help answer important question regard potential difference response brain region involve feeding .
DOC.criteria: Obese adolescent Good general health , take medication chronic basis Age 12 17 yr , puberty ( girls boy : Tanner stage II IV ) Obese Insulin Resistant Adolescents ( BMI > 95th ) ( WBISI < 1.2 plus low adiponectin < 6 ug/dl high triglyceride level > 130mg/dl ) Obese Insulin Sensitive Adolescents ( BMI > 95th ) ( WBISI > 3 ) plus high adiponectin > 8 ug/ml triglyceride level > 80 mg/dl Girls begin menstruate must negative pregnancy test study Eligibility criterion healthy nonobese child adolescent : Brother sister obesity Age 12 17 year Normal fast glucose lipid child , normal OGTT No use medication know affect glucose , lipid metabolism inflammation No endocrinopathies No use antipsychotic medication BMI > 25th < 75th ( Center Disease Control ( CDC ) BMI Charts ) Minimum weight 90lbs ( CDC Growth Charts ) Exclusion Criteria Baseline creatinine > 1.0 mg Pregnancy Presence endocrinopathies ( e.g . Cushing syndrome ) Cardiac pulmonary significant chronic illness Adolescents psychiatric disorder substance abuse determine via selfreport . Use anorexic agent No metal implant
